Package AutomatonMonkSeal

Class StateMachineBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • AutomatonMonkSeal.StateMachineBase
  • public class StateMachineBase
extends java.lang.Object

    StateMachineBase

    The StateMachineBase class gives a generical implementation of finite states machines in order to extend to a more complex automatic systems.
    Since:
    2018-10-21

      • addState

        public void addState​(java.lang.String state,
                     java.lang.Runnable entryCode,
                     java.lang.Runnable exitCode,
                     java.lang.Runnable endStateCode,
                     boolean initial)
              throws InitialStateException,
                     DuplicatedStateException
        This method adds an state to the machine, this requires the entry code, the exit code and the end state code, and if the state was the initial state.
        Parameters:
        state - The name of the new state to add to the machine's state map.
        entryCode - The code that the machine executes when it enters in this state.
        exitCode - The code that the machine executes when it exits in this state.
        endStateCode - The code that the machine executes when it ends to read the sequeance.
        initial - Boolean variable that indicates if the state is initial.
        Throws:
        InitialStateException - Exception throwed if the machine already has an initial state.
        DuplicatedStateException - Exception throwed if the mahcine already has the state in its map.
        See Also:
        InitialStateException, DuplicatedStateException

      • setState

        public void setState​(java.lang.String state)
        This method set up the initial state of the machine, in order of execute it the first of all states.
        Parameters:
        state - The state to set up the machine.

      • setState

        public void setState​(java.lang.String state,
                     boolean triggerEvent)
        This method is used to updated the state of the machine while it transitionates over a sequence. When changes the state, it triggers the code to execute.
        Parameters:
        state - The new state that the machines goes to.
        triggerEvent - A boolean that determines if the machine triggers the code or not.

      • addTransition

        public void addTransition​(TransitionBase trans)
                   throws NoStateException
        This method its used to add the transitions to the states of the machine.
        Parameters:
        trans - Its an object from class TransitionBase, that will be added to the correspondent start state of the transition.
        Throws:
        NoStateException - If no exists the start state of the transition, this exception will trigger.
        See Also:
        TransitionBase, NoStateException

      • addEvent

        public void addEvent​(java.lang.String evtName)
              throws NoTransitionException
        This method will add an event/element to the machine in order to make it trigger a transition and execute some code.
        Parameters:
        evtName - Identifier of the event that triggers the transition.
        Throws:
        NoTransitionException - This exception will triggers if there isn't any transition in the state for the given event.
        See Also:
        NoTransitionException

      • evaluateSequence

        public void evaluateSequence​(java.lang.String[] seq)
                      throws NoTransitionException
        This method makes the machine evaluate a complete sequence of events.
        Parameters:
        seq - A vector of events to evaluate by the machine
        Throws:
        NoTransitionException - This exception will triggers if there isn't any transition in the state for the given event.
        See Also:
        NoTransitionException
